summary: This document is an email chain from May 28, 2020, discussing scheduling for a call about the Epstein probate case. It includes a forwarded email from February 2020 summarizing key developments in the probate proceedings, including the Virgin Islands Attorney General's actions against the estate, demands for a victim compensation program, and the freezing of estate assets.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as someone with whom a 30-minute meeting needs to be scheduled regarding the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.context: The Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands who has brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged fraud by his lawyers, placed liens on estate assets, and outlined demands for a victim compensation program.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will and accused by the Virgin Islands AG of potentially being part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will and accused by the Virgin Islands AG of potentially being part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Represented Epstein's estate in court, claiming the Virgin Islands AG's liens have prevented the release of money for a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reported to have been asked by the estate to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers, having previously overseen major settlement funds.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of a Guardian article dated February 12, 2020, about the dispute between Epstein's estate lawyers and the Virgin Islands AG.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose estate is the subject of the probate proceedings, victim claims, and criminal investigations.

connections.description: Both are named as executors of Epstein's will and are jointly accused by the Virgin Islands AG of potentially facilitating Epstein's alleged fraud.
Indyke was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor in his will.
Kahn was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor in his will.
Moskowitz is the lawyer representing the Epstein estate, of which Indyke is an executor.
Moskowitz is the lawyer representing the Epstein estate, of which Kahn is an executor.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against the estate and alleged Indyke may have been part of Epstein's fraud.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against the estate and alleged Kahn may have been part of Epstein's fraud.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Files Charges Against Estate
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleging fraud related to a banking license and naming his lawyers as potential co-defendants.

events.title: Probate Court Denies Virgin Islands AG Intervention
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein probate proceedings.

events.title: Estate Files for Emergency Relief
events.description: The executors of Epstein's estate moved the probate court for emergency relief to access frozen estate funds to pay administrative expenses without the Virgin Islands AG's prior approval.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest on Federal Charges
events.description: Epstein was arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Guilty Plea
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has placed liens on Epstein's estate assets, freezing bank accounts and demanding prior approval for all expenditures.
George has charged Epstein's estate with fraud and alleged his lawyers/executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of the alleged criminal enterprise.

Key demands from the Virgin Islands AG for a victim compensation program include: estate cooperation with investigations, waiving NDAs for former employees, no required third-party releases for victims, a complete asset inventory, and removing executors from the program's administration.
Epstein's estate, valued around $570 million, has proposed a victim compensation fund to be overseen by settlement expert Ken Feinberg, but this is being contested.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the US Virgin Islands, naming Indyke and Kahn as executors.
